prompts.prompt: Select any 1D part(s) or enter a part number.
Select any 2D part(s) or enter a part number.
Select any 3D part(s) or enter a part number.
Select any part(s) or enter a part number.
Select any 1D or 2D part(s) or enter a part number.
Select any 2D or 3D part(s) or enter a part number.
Select a vector variable.
Select a scalar variable.
Enter a constant variable name or a constant value.
Select a velocity variable.
Select a scalar or vector variable.
Select a scalar, vector or constant variable.
Select a density variable or enter a value.
Select a viscosity variable.
Select a pressure variable.
Enter a beginning time step.
Enter an ending time step.
Enter a variable name or a value.
Enter a vector component [X], [Y], [Z] or [] for magnitude.
Select a momentum variable.
Select a scalar variable or enter a 0 to indicate a 2D case.
Select a stagnation energy variable.
Enter a 'ratio of specific heats'(value>=1.0).
Enter a component [X], [Y], or [Z].
Enter a gas constant variable or value(>0.0).
Select a viscosity variable or enter a value.
Select any 2D part(s) or enter a part number.
Select a velocity (magnitude) gradient variable.
Select a turbulent kinetic energy variable.
Select a turbulent dissipation variable.
Select a 'laminar viscosity' variable or enter a value.
Select a 'ratio of specific heats' variable or enter a value.
Select a 'freestream density' variable or enter a value(>=1.0).
Select a 'freestream velocity magnitude' variable or value(>=1.0)
Select a 'freestream speed of sound' variable or enter a value(>=1.0).
Select a node based scalar or vector variable.
Select an element based scalar or vector variable.
Enter an offset value.
Enter a frequency value in degrees or leave blank and UNDEFINED will be used.
Select a complex scalar variable.
Select a scalar/vector variable for the imaginary portion.
Select a scalar/vector variable for the real portion.
Enter a value for PHI(Range 0.0 - 360.0).
Select a complex scalar or vector variable.
Select a tensor, first principal scalar(sigma_1), or tensor scalar component(T11).
Select a tensor component scalar variable.
Select a tensor variable.
Enter a the row(ie. 1-3) of the tensor to extract.
Enter a the column(ie. 1-3) of the tensor to extract.
Enter which eigenvalue number(ie. 1-3).
Enter which eigenvector number(ie. 1-3).
Select a scalar variable for component T11.
Select a scalar variable for component T22.
Select a scalar variable for component T33.
Select a scalar variable for component T12.
Select a scalar variable for component T13.
Select a scalar variable for component T23.
Select any part(s) to map the variable to or enter a part number.
Enter number of the case to map the variable from.
Enter 0 for "Global search", 1 for "Dimension match", 2 for "Part to Part", or 3 for "Selected Parts".
Enter 0 for "search only" or 1 for "grab closest value if search fails".
A constant variable from a map function (e.g. MapCartesian)
Sampling function options.
Tolerance beyond which cartesian mapping is considered "failed".
Select a nodal displacement variable or 0 for none.
Select a total energy variable.
Select a temperature variable.
Select a specific gas constant variable or enter a constant value.
Select a density variable.
Select any iblanked structured part(s) and select Next or enter a part #.
Select a constant variable or enter a value to assign scalar per node.
Select a constant variable or enter a value to assign scalar per element.
Select any massed particle trace part(s) and select Next or enter a part number.
Select a surface normal variable.
Select a force vector variable.
Enter first node number.
Enter second node number.
Enter scalar value.
Enter dimension of boundary part elements (ie. 0-3).
Enter dimension of corresponding field part elements (ie. 2-3).
Select a scalar variable for component T21.
Select a scalar variable for component T31.
Select a scalar variable for component T32.
Select a scalar, vector, tensor or constant variable.
Select a scalar, vector, or tensor variable.
Enter flow direction: 0=Tangent or 1=Normal to the surface.
Enter flow direction: 0=Tangent to surface, or this Tangent flow's 1=Streamwise or 2=Crosswise component.
Select a total pressure variable.
Select a constant 'freestream density' variable or enter a constant value(>0.).
Select a constant 'freestream velocity magnitude' variable or enter a constant value(>0.).
Enter a ymax profiling distance (>0), (enter 0 for convergence alg.).
Select any boundary part(s) and select Next, or enter a boundary part number.
Enter a Grad(|Velocity|) vector, or -1 to approximate it.
Select any material(s) and select Next, or enter a material name.
Select any specie(s) or enter a species name or select None(null).
Select an element-based scalar variable, or enter a scalar value.
Select any model part(s) or enter a model part number.
Select any part(s) or enter a part #.
Select the second principal scalar(sigma_2) or tensor scalar component(T22).
Select the third principal scalar(sigma_3) or tensor scalar component(T33).
Select tensor scalar component(T12) or enter a -1 if doing principals.
Select tensor scalar component(T13) or enter a -1 if doing principals.
Select tensor scalar component(T23) or enter a -1 if doing principals.
Enter X direction component value.
Enter Y direction component value.
Enter Z direction component value.
Enter number of points to use in integration direction.
Enter tangent flow component 1=Streamwise or 2=Crosswise to surface.
Select a material and select Next, or enter a material name.
Select a reduction operation (0=sum, 1=avg, 2=min, 3=max)
Enter surface shear-stress option: 0=RMS(Stream,Cross), or 1=Streamwise:dVs/dn or 2=Crossflow:dVc/dn component.
Enter option to extract Velocity at edge of BL: 0=Vedge, or decomposed 1=Vparallel or 2=Vnormal to surface.
Enter the origin part number. This part must also be in the previous part list.
To select a signed distance, enter a nodal normal vector for the origin part or choose None to compute an unsigned distance.
Select the function to compute. 0=sum, 1=mean, 2=variance, 3=skewness, 4=kurtosis.
Select a scalar variable or enter a value.
Select the constant output variable from a StatReg*() function.
Enter the number of the statistic to output. 0=SS Error 1=SS Total 2=SS Model 3=R squared.
Enter the number of the statistic to output. 0=Coefficient 1=SS Variable 2=Partial SS Variable 3=Coeficient stderr.
Select the variable for which to return the statistic. 0=x0, 1=x1, 2=x2 3=x3, 4=x4.
Select origin part and field part(s), or enter the origin part number and the field part number(s).
Enter 0 for minium or 1 for maximum
Enter the number of passes to use
Select a constant or a nodal scalar weighting factor
Enter value limit - value under which the variable will be Undefined
Enter Viewport number for 3D model in correct camera orientation
Enter the part to map the variable from.
Select any 2D clip part(s) or enter a part number.
Select the vorticity gamma function id.
Specify a proximity radius (model units) to be used around each base node/cell for its proximity area. Enter a constant value, or select a constant or scalar variable.
Include all cells containing the target node/cell, plus cells where 'all' or 'any' of their nodes are within the target node proximity radius.
Select a Verdict library element quality metric to compute.
Select an element based scalar variable.
Select a vector variable to specify a spatially varying gradient direction or choose None to select a the cartesian XYZ axis direction.
Select the spatial component in which to compute the derivative.
Select the method used to compute the derivative.
Select any structured part(s) and select Next or enter a part #.
Enter 0 for "Use field velocity (to compute wall gradient)", 1 for "Use gradient at boundary part", or 2 for "Use gradient in field part".
Specify the frame number to use for the cylindrical coordinate system.
Select the cylindrical axis to compute.
Select the rectangular axis to compute.
Select the direction to project.
Per/Case or Per/Part Results
Set value for per part constant variable
Select a defect scalar per element variable or enter a value.
Select a computed Defect scalar per element variable.
Select a minimum defect constant variable or specify a value.
Select a maximum defect constant variable or specify a value.
Specify a scale factor multiplied to the scalar per element values.
Select the 2D part that represents the hub of the channel.
Select the 2D part that represents the shroud of the channel.
Select the 2D part that represents the inlet of the channel.
Select the 2D part that represents the outlet of the channel.
X component of the channel rotational axis origin.
Y component of the channel rotational axis origin.
Z component of the channel rotational axis origin.
X component of the channel rotational axis normal.
Y component of the channel rotational axis normal.
Z component of the channel rotational axis normal.
Algorithm options.
Offset for axis normalized coordinates.
Set to 1 if the dataset is a full 360 degree dataset.
Part that will receive the integrated values.
Variable to be integrated.
Displacement field mapping coords to unit space.
Turbosurface integration options.
Scalar field used to modulate integral weighting.
Vector field used to modulate integral weighting (via dot w/normal).
Axisymmetric parameter options.
Axisymmetric angle.
Normal handling options.
Stage number used in RZ recomputation.

enum.name: Parts selected for case to map from
Only XY for the first value
Use field velocity (to compute wall gradient)

function.name: Area
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the sum of the area of the specified parts plus the surface area if any 3D elements exist.

function.name: BL_aGradOfVelMag
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the gradient of the magnitude of the specified velocity variable on the specified boundary part(s)

function.name: BL_CfEdge
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the edge skin-friction coefficient

param.name: opt for a gradient of velo-mag

function.name: BL_CfWall
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the skin-friction coefficient

param.name: opt for a gradient of velo-mag

function.name: BL_CfWallCmp
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the component of the skin-friction coefficient tangent or parallel to the wall in either the steam-wise or cross-flow direction

param.name: opt for a gradient of velo-mag

function.name: BL_CfWallTau
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the fluid's shear-stress at the wall or in its stream-wise or cross-flow component direction

param.name: opt for a gradient of velo-mag

function.name: BL_DispThick
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the boundary-layer displacement thickness

param.name: opt for a gradient of velo-mag

function.name: BL_DistToValue
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the distance from the wall to the specified value

function.name: BL_MomeThick
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the boundary momentum thickness

param.name: opt for a gradient of velo-mag

function.name: BL_Scalar
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the scalar value of the corresponding scalar field at the edge of the boundary layer.

param.name: opt for a gradient of velo-mag.

function.name: BL_RecoveryThick
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the boundary layer recovery thickness

param.name: opt for a gradient of velo-mag.

function.name: BL_Thick
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the boundary layer thickness

param.name: opt for a gradient of velo-mag

function.name: BL_VelocityAtEdge
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as one of Ve, Vn, or Vp where Ve = velocity vector at edge of boundary layer, Vn = decomposed velocity vector normal to the wall at the edge of the boundary layer, or Vp = the decomposed velocity vector parallel to the wall at the edge of the boundary layer.

param.name: opt for a gradient of velo-mag

function.name: BL_Y1Plus
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the coefficient-off-the-wall to the 1st field cell centroid

function.name: BL_Y1PlusPre1014
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the coefficient-off-the-wall to the 1st field cell centroid

param.name: opt for a gradient of velo-mag

function.name: BL_Y1PlusDist
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the off-the-wall distance to the 1st field cell centroid. (Note: Velocity only used to determine reference sense (nodal or elemental) of variable to coincide with BL_Y1Plus.)

function.name: BoundaryLayerParams
function.description: Boundary Layer Parameters.

function.name: CaseMap
function.description: Computes a field variable (scalar, vector, or tensor) on the selected parts by searching for the node/element location in the case specified.

function.name: CaseMapDiff
function.description: Computes a field variable (scalar, vector, or tensor) on the selected parts by searching for the node/element location in the case specified. Results is the field variable minus the case map.

function.name: CaseMapImage
function.description: Computes a scalar variable by projecting a 2d image to a 3d geometry given the view in a specific viewport

function.name: Coeff
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the surface integral of a scalar variable multiplied by the x, y, or z component of the surface normal

function.name: Cmplx
function.description: Computes a complex scalar or vector from two scalar or vector variables, Z = A + Bi. The frequency is optional and is used only for reference.

function.name: CmplxArg
function.description: Computes a scalar in range -180 to 180 degrees defined as the argument of a complex scalar or vector: Arg = atan(Vi/Vr).

function.name: CmplxConj
function.description: Computes a complex scalar or vector defined as the conjugate of a given complex scalar or vector variable: Nr = Vr, Ni = -Vi

function.name: CmplxImag
function.description: Computes a scalar or vector variable defined as the imaginary portion of a complex scalar/vector

function.name: CmplxModu
function.description: Computes a scalar or vector variable defined as the modulus of a complex scalar/vector

function.name: CmplxReal
function.description: Computes a scalar or vector variable defined as the real portion of a complex scalar/vector

function.name: CmplxTransResp
function.description: Computes a scalar or vector variable defined as the real transient response of a complex scalar/vector variable given a transient phase angle. Function is only valid for harmonic variations.

function.name: ConstantPerPart
function.description: Assigns a constant value as a constant per part variable

function.name: Curl
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the curl of the vector variable specified

function.name: Defect_BulkVolume
function.description: Computes a per element scalar variable defined as the bulk volume of defect cells that share a face.

function.name: Defect_Count
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the count of the defects that exist between a specifed min and max value of any of the computed Defect scalar variables.

function.name: Defect_LargestLinearExtent
function.description: Computes a per element scalar variable defined as the largest linear extent of the defect.

function.name: Defect_NetVolume
function.description: Computes a per element scalar variable defined as the sum of the product of cell volumes with the specified scalar variable of the cells comprising the defect.

function.name: Defect_ShapeFactor
function.description: Computes a per node scalar variable defined as the largest linear extent divided by the diameter of the sphere whose volume equals the bulk volume of cells comprising the defect.

function.name: Defect_SurfaceArea
function.description: Computes a per element scalar variable defined as the surface area of the defect.

function.name: Density
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the density as a function of pressure, temperature, and gas constant

function.name: DensityLogNorm
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the natural log of the normalized density

function.name: DensityNorm
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the normalized density

function.name: DensityNormStag
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the normalized stagnation density

function.name: DensityStag
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the stagnation density

function.name: Deriv
function.description: Computes the derivative of a scalar or vector variable

function.name: Dist2Nodes
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the Euclidean distance between the two node IDs specified

function.name: Dist2Part
function.description: Computes a nodal scalar variable defined as the smallest Euclidean distance from the nodes of the origin part to the nodes of the parts specified. If a vector is given the result will be signed.

function.name: Dist2PartElem
function.description: Computes a nodal scalar variable defined as the smallest Euclidean distance from the elements of the origin part to the nodes of the parts specified. If a vector is given the result will be signed.

function.name: Div
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the divergence of the vector specified.

function.name: EleMetric
function.description: Computes a per-element scalar variable on any parts, whose value is one of a collection of element quality metric functions.

function.name: ElemToNode
function.description: Compute a node based variable from a element based scalar or vector by simple nodal averaging.

function.name: ElemToNodeWeighted
function.description: Compute a node based variable from a element based scalar or vector by weighted nodal averaging.

function.name: EleSize
function.description: Compute an element based scalar variable defined as the length/Area/Volume of 1d/2d/3d elements in the parts specified.

function.name: EnergyT
function.description: Compute a scalar variable defined as the total energy per unit volume given density, pressure, velocity, and ratio of specific heats.

function.name: Enthalpy
function.description: Compute a scalar variable defined as the enthalpy given total energy, density, velocity, and ratio of specific heats.

function.name: EnthalpyNorm
function.description: Compute a scalar variable defined as the normalized enthalpy given total energy, density, velocity, ratio of specific heats, and freestream density and speed of sound

function.name: EnthalpyNormStag
function.description: Compute a scalar variable defined as the normalized stagnation enthalpy given total energy, density, velocity, ratio of specific heats, and freestream values

function.name: EnthalpyStag
function.description: Compute a scalar variable defined as the stagnation enthalpy given total energy, density, velocity, and ratio of specific heats

function.name: Entropy
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the entropy given total energy, density, velocity, ratio of specific heats, gas constant, and freestream values

function.name: Flow
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the volume flow rate, i.e., the surface integral of the velocity in the surface normal direction.

function.name: FlowRate
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the component of velocity in the surface normal direction.

function.name: FluidShear
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the shear stress multiplied by the velocity gradient in the surface normal direction

function.name: FluidShearMax
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the turbulent plus laminar viscosity multiplied by the local strain

function.name: Force
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the pressure*area force acting in the surface normal direction.

function.name: Force1D
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the pressure*length force acting in the normal direction given

function.name: Grad
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the gradient of a scalar or vector magnitude

function.name: GradApprox
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the gradient of a scalar or vector magnitude using a closed form solution on a subdivided geometry.

function.name: GradTensor
function.description: Computes a tensor variable defined as the gradient of a vector variable

function.name: GradTensorApprox
function.description: Computes a tensor variable defined as the gradient of a vector variable using a closed form solution on a subdivided geometry.

function.name: HelicityDensity
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the helicity computed by dotting the velocity with vorticity

function.name: HelicityRelative
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the relative helicity computed by dotting the velocity with vorticity and dividing by the velocity and vorticity magnitudes.

function.name: HelicityRelFilter
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the relative filtered helicity = the relative helicity if the helicity density is greater or equal to the filter value and = 0 if the helicity density is less than the filter value. The filter value is defined to be .1*Vinf^2 where Vinf is the freestream velocity magnitude

function.name: IblankingValues
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the iblanking value. Only applies to structured data with iblanking.

function.name: IJKValues
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the I,J,K values. Only applies to structured data.

function.name: IntegralLine
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the integral of the variable specified over the length of the part(s)

function.name: IntegralSurface
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the integral of the variable specified over the surface of the part(s)

function.name: IntegralVolume
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the integral of the variable specified over the volume of the part(s)

function.name: KinEn
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the kinetic energy 0.5*rho*V^2

function.name: Length
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the sum of the length of all 1D elements. Parts composed of 2D or 3D elements need to be in Feature rep to obtain a value

function.name: LineVectors
function.description: Computes a nodal vector variable defined as the vector from the first to the last node of each 1d element of the part(s). Variable is undefined for non 1d elements

function.name: Mach
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as Speed/Speed_of_sound where Speed_of_sound is computed from the ratio of specific heats, pressure, and density

function.name: MakeScalElem
function.description: Computes a scalar per element variable defined as a specified value or constant variable

function.name: MakeScalElemId
function.description: Computes a scalar per element variable defined as the element ids for the part

function.name: MakeScalNode
function.description: Computes a scalar per node variable defined as a specified value or constant variable

function.name: MakeScalNodeId
function.description: Computes a scalar per node variable defined as the node ids for the part

function.name: MakeVect
function.description: Computes a vector variable using three scalar/constant variables or constant values for the x, y, and z components.

function.name: MapCartesian
function.description: Create a cartesian space mapping variable for use with MapSample

function.name: MapSample
function.description: Computes a field variable (scalar, vector, or tensor) on the selected parts by searching in the parts selected via the mapping var (e.g. MapCartesian).

function.name: MassedParticle
function.description: Computes a per element scalar variable defined as the total mass of massed particles that collide with a surface

function.name: MassFluxAvg
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the mass flux average

function.name: MatSpecies
function.description: Computes a per element scalar variable defined as the sum of all specified materials and species combinations multiplied by the specific element variable.

function.name: MatToScalar
function.description: Computes a per element scalar variable defined as the material fraction

function.name: Max
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined to be the maximum of the variable specified.

function.name: Min
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined to be the minimum of the variable specified.

function.name: Moment
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined to be the x, y, or z moment about the cursor tool location given a force vector

function.name: Momentum
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as density*Velocity

function.name: MomentVector
function.description: Computes a nodal vector variables defined as the x, y, or z moment about each node given a force vector

function.name: NodeCount
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the number of nodes in the part(s) selected

function.name: NodeToElem
function.description: Computes an element based variable from a node based variable

function.name: Normal
function.description: Computes an element based vector variable defined as the surface normal for the parts selected

function.name: NormVect
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the normalized unit vector for the vector specified

function.name: NormC
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the normal constraint defined as the surface integral as a function of pressure, velocity, and viscosity

function.name: OffsetField
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the offset in the surface normal direction (from the border if 3D)

function.name: OffsetVar
function.description: Computes a variable defined as the variable value offset in the surface normal direction into a field. It provides a way to place near surface values onto the surface.

function.name: PartNumber
function.description: Computes a part or case constant variable defined as the part id number. Sometimes useful for viewing decomposed data.

function.name: Pres
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as Pressure where Pressure is computed from the density, total energy, velocity, and ratio of specific heats

function.name: PresCoef
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the Pressure-Coefficient as a function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats, and the freestream values

function.name: PresDynam
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the dynamic pressure as a function of the density and velocity)

function.name: PresLogNorm
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the log (ln) of the pressure divided by the freestream pressure as a function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats, and the freestream values

function.name: PresNorm
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the normalized pressure = pressure divided by freestream pressure as a function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats, and the freestream values

function.name: PresNormStag
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the normalized stagnation pressure = stagnation pressure divided by freestream stagnation pressure as a function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats, and the freestream values

function.name: PresPitot
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the pitot pressure as a function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats

function.name: PresPitotRatio
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the pitot pressure ratio as a function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats, and the freestream values

function.name: PresStag
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the stagnation pressure as a function of density, total energy, velocity, and ratio of specific heats

function.name: PresStagCoef
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the stagnation pressure coefficient as a function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats, and the freestream values

function.name: PresT
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the total pressure = pressure + density*velocity^2/2

function.name: Radiograph_grid
function.description: Computes a per element scalar variable defined as the integration of a variable in the direction specified through the model given a specified integration step

function.name: Radiograph_mesh
function.description: Computes a per element scalar variable defined as the integration of the variable in the direction specified through the model given

function.name: RectToCyl
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the radial, tangential, and z component according to specified frame. Intended for calculation purposes

function.name: ServerNumber
function.description: Computes a per element scalar defined as the server number that contains the element. Useful for decomposed data debugging

function.name: ShockPlot3d
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as shock using the plot3d definition. Function of density, total energy, velocity, and ratio of specific heats

function.name: SmoothMesh
function.description: Computes a per node vector when applied as a displacement to the part will produce a smoother surface. Useful for smoothing isosurfaces for example

function.name: SonicSpeed
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the sonic speed. Function of density, total energy, velocity, and ratio of specific heats

function.name: SpaMean
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the volume (or area) weighted mean of the variable specified

function.name: SpaMeanWeighted
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the volume (or area) weighted mean of the variable specified. Volume or area is weighted by a second variable.

function.name: SpaMeanMass
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the volume (or area) weighted mean of the variable specified, adjusted for density and flow.

function.name: SpaMeanPower
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the volume (or area) weighted mean of the variable specified, adjusted for density and flow, and raised to a power.

function.name: Speed
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as speed = square root of the sum of the velocity components squared

function.name: StatMoment
function.description: Computes a constant variable defined as the statistics function over all nodes or elements of the parts selected. The statistical functions available are sum, mean, variance, skew, and kurtosis

function.name: StatRegSpa
function.description: Computes a constant value defined as the multi-variate linear regression statistics for the variable selected

function.name: StatRegVal1
function.description: Computes a constant value defined as the statistics from a StatReg linear regression. The options are sum of squares error, sum of squares modal, and R-squared

function.name: StatRegVal2
function.description: Computes a constant value defined as the statistics from a StatReg linear regression given a specified coefficient. The options are the estimated coefficient, sum of squares for the variable, partial sum of squares of the variable, and standard error for the coefficient

function.name: Stream
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the stream function. Function of velocity and density

function.name: Swirl
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the swirl. Function of density and velocity

function.name: Temperature
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as temperature. Function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats, and the gas constant

function.name: TemperLogNorm
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the natural log of the normalized temperature. Function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats, and the freestream values

function.name: TemperNorm
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the normalized temperature = temperature/freestream temperature. Function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats, gas constant and freestream values

function.name: TemperNormStag
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the normalized stagnation temperature = stagnation temperature/freestream stagnation temperature. Function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats, gas constant, and the freestream values

function.name: TemperStag
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the stagnation temperature. Function of density, total energy, velocity, ratio of specific heats, and gas constant

function.name: TempMean
function.description: Computes a variable defined as the temporal mean of the specified variable at the nodes/elements given a range of timesteps

function.name: TempMinmaxField
function.description: Computes a variable defined as the minimum or maximum (user choice) of the specified variable at the nodes/elements given a range of timesteps

function.name: TensorComponent
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the specified component of a tensor

function.name: TensorDeterminant
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the determinant of a tensor. Tensor can be defined as 3 principal scalars or 6 tensor scalar components

function.name: TensorEigenvalue
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the eigenvalue (1 to 3) of the specified tensor

function.name: TensorEigenvector
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the first, second, or third eigenvector of the specified tensor

function.name: TensorMake
function.description: Computes a symmetric tensor variable from six scalars. [The 6 tensor components order is TC11, TC22, TC33, TC12, TC13, TC23]

function.name: TensorMakeAsym
function.description: Computes an asymmetric tensor variable from nine scalars. [The 9 tensor components order is TC11,TC12,TC13, TC21,TC22,TC23, TC31,TC32,TC33]

function.name: TensorTresca
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the tresca of the given tensor, three principals, or six tensor components. [If components specified the order is TC11, TC22, TC33, TC12, TC13, TC23]

function.name: TensorVonMises
function.description: Computes a scalar variable defined as the von-mises of the given tensor, three principals, or six tensor components. [If components specified the order is TC11, TC22, TC33, TC12, TC13, TC23]

function.name: AxisymmetricParams
function.description: Compute axissymmetric volume weights and element normals.

function.name: TurboSurfaceIntegral
function.description: Compute a circumferential integral following turbo machinery conventions.

function.name: TurboSurfaceProjection
function.description: Compute the projection of coordinates into normalized turbo machinery conventions.

function.name: Vector1DProjection
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the specified vector variable projected into the 1D part's tangent or normal direction

function.name: VectorCylProjection
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the specified vector variable projected onto a frame's axis, radial, or theta direction

function.name: VectorDispProjection
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined by projecting a vector variable through a displacement field

param.name: vector to project
param.description: vector to project, may be a scalar for RA reprojection

param.name: stage
param.description: Stage number used in RZ reprojection

function.name: VectorRectProjection
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the specified vector variable projected onto a frame's x, y, or z direction

function.name: Velo
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as velocity = momentum/density

function.name: Vol
function.description: Computes the volume of the parts specified

function.name: Vort
function.description: Computes a vector variable defined as the vorticity as a function of velocity

function.name: VortGamma
function.description: Computes a dimensionless scalar variable on a 2D clip part, whose value is the vorticity-gamma function
